title: Calories in Pot Roast
meta_description: Discover calories in pot roast per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Beef chuck pot roast with carrots, potatoes, onions; slow-cooked in broth; includes meat and vegetables; no added salt or thickeners.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, meat cut, vegetable ratios, cooking method, and portion size. Check specific recipes or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Pot roast has about 250 kcal per 100 g, providing 22 g protein and moderate fat from the beef.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant versions.

tweaks.label: Use leaner beef cut (e.g., round instead of chuck)

faqs.q: How many calories in pot roast per serving?
faqs.a: A typical 250 g serving has about 625 kcal; adjust based on portion size.

faqs.q: Is pot roast high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 22 g protein per 100 g, mainly from the beef.

faqs.q: What affects calories in pot roast?
faqs.a: Meat fat content, added oils, vegetable types, and cooking liquids like broth or wine.

faqs.q: How much fat is in pot roast?
faqs.a: Around 16 g total fat per 100 g, with 6 g saturated.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in pot roast?
faqs.a: Yes, about 4 g per 100 g from included vegetables like potatoes and carrots.
